tool.name: load
tool.command:
chakin load blast '$analysis_id' '$input'
#if $blastdb: --blastdb '$blastdb' #end if #if $blastdb_id: --blastdb_id '$blastdb_id' #end if #if $blast_parameters: --blast_parameters '$blast_parameters' #end if #if $query_re: --query_re '$query_re' #end if #if $query_type: --query_type '$query_type' #end if #if $query_uniquename: $query_uniquename #end if
| jq -S . > $results

param.name: input
param.label: Input
param.help: Path to the Blast XML file to load

param.name: blastdb
param.label: Blastdb
param.help: Name of the database blasted against (must be in the Chado db table)

param.name: blastdb_id
param.label: Blastdb Id
param.help: ID of the database blasted against (must be in the Chado db table)

param.name: blast_parameters
param.label: Blast Parameters
param.help: Blast parameters used to produce these results

param.name: query_re
param.label: Query Re
param.help: The regular expression that can uniquely identify the query name. This parameters is required if the feature name is not the first word in the blast query name.

param.name: query_type
param.label: Query Type
param.help: The feature type (e.g. 'gene', 'mRNA', 'polypeptide', 'contig') of the query. It must be a valid Sequence Ontology term.

param.name: query_uniquename
param.label: Query Uniquename
param.help: Use this if the --query-re regular expression matches unique names instead of names in the database.

tool.help:
Load a blast analysis, in the same way as does the tripal_analysis_blast module
@HELP@
